title: Caldbeck to Carlisle Walking Route

images.title: Andrew Smith / Pasture, Sebergham
images.caption: Pasture, Sebergham. Looking towards the northern Pennines from near the Goose Green crossroads. The silo is at Bulman Hill.

images.title: Philip Halling / River Caldew, Carlisle
images.caption: The River Caldew just upstream from its confluence with the River Eden in Carlisle.

images.title: Lis Burke / Pastures above the Caldew
images.caption: Pastures above the Caldew

images.title: Andrew Smith / Plantations above the Caldew
images.caption: Plantations above the Caldew. The conifers here have been felled. Deciduous trees have been planted in their place. A few older ones remain. Looking east.

description: This is the fifth and final leg of the Cumbria Way taking you from Caldbeck to the finish point in Carlisle. This section descends to Carlisle following the River Caldew for most of the route. You will pass through the villages of Sebergham, Buckabank and Dalston walking on a mixture of public footpaths and bridleways.
display_address: The Watermill Cafe, Friar Row, Upton, Wigton, Cumberland, England, CA7 8DR, United Kingdom
